q: The secret of success lies not in doing your own work, but in recognizing the right man to do it.
h:
“The secret of success lies not in doing your own work, but in recognizing the right man to do it.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Don't concern yourself with the money. Be of service. Build. Work. Dream. Create.
h:
“Don't concern yourself with the money. Be of service. Build. Work. Dream. Create.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Friendship takes time and energy if it's going to work.
h:
“Friendship takes time and energy if it's going to work.” —
Betty White

q: The biggest mistake we could ever make in our lives is to think we work for anybody but ourselves.
h:
“The biggest mistake we could ever make in our lives is to think we work for anybody but ourselves.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Desire for the fruits of work must never be your motive in working.
h:
“Desire for the fruits of work must never be your motive in working.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.
h:
“Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.” —
Ralph Marston

q: A dream doesn't become reality through magic it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
h:
“A dream doesn't become reality through magic it takes sweat, determination and hard work.” —
Colin Powell

q: What a book a devil's chaplain might write on the clumsy, wasteful, blundering, low, and horribly cruel work of nature!
h:
“What a book a devil's chaplain might write on the clumsy, wasteful, blundering, low, and horribly cruel work of nature!” —
Charles Darwin

q: If it's not broken, tinker with it till you find out how it works.
h:
“If it's not broken, tinker with it till you find out how it works.” —
Bob Proctor

q: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, learning from failure.
h:
“There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, learning from failure.” —
Colin Powell

q: It's very important to like the people you work with, otherwise life and your job is gonna be quite miserable.
h:
“It's very important to like the people you work with, otherwise life and your job is gonna be quite miserable.” —
Elon Musk

q: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
h:
“Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.” —
Aristotle

q: Nothing is really work unless you would rather be doing something else.
h:
“Nothing is really work unless you would rather be doing something else. ” —
James Matthew Barrie

q: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
h:
“Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.” —
Thomas Edison

q: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.
h:
“One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Working hard for something we don't care about is called stress: Working hard for something we love is called passion.
h:
“Working hard for something we don't care about is called stress: Working hard for something we love is called passion.” —
Simon Sinek

q: I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.
h:
“I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.” —
Estee Lauder

q: Extraordinary results happen only when you give the best you have to become the best you can be at your most important work.
h:
“Extraordinary results happen only when you give the best you have to become the best you can be at your most important work.” —
Gary Keller

q: Receive without complaint, Work with fate.
h:
“Receive without complaint, Work with fate.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Thinking is the hardest work there is. That is why so few people engage in it.
h:
“Thinking is the hardest work there is. That is why so few people engage in it.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Surround yourself with people who take their work seriously, but not themselves, those who work hard and play hard.
h:
“Surround yourself with people who take their work seriously, but not themselves, those who work hard and play hard.” —
Colin Powell

q: The only way to 'find out if it will work out' is to do it.
h:
“The only way to 'find out if it will work out' is to do it.” —
Simon Sinek

q: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
h:
“The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: Your work is to discover your work and then, with all your heart, to give yourself to it.
h:
“Your work is to discover your work and then, with all your heart, to give yourself to it.” —
Buddha

q: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
h:
“A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.” —
Lao Tzu

q: If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.
h:
“If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.” —
Unknown

q: Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.
h:
“Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.” —
Anne Frank

q: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work.
h:
“Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. ” —
Steve Jobs

q: If you want work well done, select a busy man; the other kind has no time.
h:
“If you want work well done, select a busy man; the other kind has no time.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Think how really precious is the time you have to spend, whether it's at work or with your family. Every minute should be enjoyed and savored.
h:
“Think how really precious is the time you have to spend, whether it's at work or with your family. Every minute should be enjoyed and savored.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Life is trying things to see if they work.
h:
“Life is trying things to see if they work.” —
Ray Bradbury

q: This is the real secret of life - to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.
h:
“This is the real secret of life - to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.” —
Alan Watts

q: Don't worry about being successful, but work toward being significant and the success will naturally follow.
h:
“Don't worry about being successful, but work toward being significant and the success will naturally follow.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Nothing will work unless you do.
h:
“Nothing will work unless you do.” —
Maya Angelou

q: Inspiration exists, but it has to find you working.
h:
“Inspiration exists, but it has to find you working.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Confidence is not a guarantee of success, but a pattern of thinking that will improve your likelihood of success, a tenacious search for ways to make things work.
h:
“Confidence is not a guarantee of success, but a pattern of thinking that will improve your likelihood of success, a tenacious search for ways to make things work.” —
John Eliot

q: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.
h:
“Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: The older you get, the more you understand how your conscience works.
h:
“The older you get, the more you understand how your conscience works.” —
Criss Jami

q: I put my heart and soul into my work, and I have lost my mind in the process.
h:
“I put my heart and soul into my work, and I have lost my mind in the process.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.
h:
“Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
h:
“Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life. ” —
Confucius

q: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
h:
“I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.” —
Thomas Edison

q: All happiness depends on courage and work.
h:
“All happiness depends on courage and work.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Work joyfully and peacefully, knowing that right thoughts and right efforts inevitably bring about right results.
h:
“Work joyfully and peacefully, knowing that right thoughts and right efforts inevitably bring about right results.” —
James Allen

q: Focused, hard work is the real key to success.
h:
“Focused, hard work is the real key to success.” —
John Carmack

q: If you don't find the time, if you don't do the work, you don't get the results.
h:
“If you don't find the time, if you don't do the work, you don't get the results.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: Until you change how you get things done, you'll never know what works best.
h:
“Until you change how you get things done, you'll never know what works best.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: I learned the value of hard work by working hard.
h:
“I learned the value of hard work by working hard. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: Work harder on yourself than you do on your job.
h:
“Work harder on yourself than you do on your job.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Stop wasting time defending your problems and work on addressing them instead.
h:
“Stop wasting time defending your problems and work on addressing them instead.” —
Celestine Chua
